box.description: Planar layers - simple but limited coverage

cylinder_barrel.description: Cylindrical layers - excellent for barrel region

projective_tower.description: Towers pointing to IP - optimal for collider physics

hermeticity.definition: Solid angle coverage around interaction point
hermeticity.box: Limited to forward direction, large uncovered regions
hermeticity.cylinder_barrel: Full azimuthal coverage in barrel region (|eta| < 1.5)
hermeticity.projective_tower: Excellent coverage with minimal gaps due to pointing geometry

crack_effects.definition: Energy loss in gaps between detector modules
crack_effects.box: Severe - planar boundaries create large dead regions
crack_effects.cylinder_barrel: Moderate - only gaps at barrel-endcap boundaries
crack_effects.projective_tower: Minimal - towers point toward vertex, reducing shower leakage

jet_energy_measurement.definition: Accuracy of measuring jet energy and direction
jet_energy_measurement.box: Poor - jets spread across module boundaries, energy loss
jet_energy_measurement.cylinder_barrel: Good - uniform response in phi, but eta boundaries problematic
jet_energy_measurement.projective_tower: Excellent - jet axis aligned with tower pointing, minimal spreading

shower_containment.definition: Fraction of shower energy captured within detector
shower_containment.box: Good - uniform material thickness, predictable containment
shower_containment.cylinder_barrel: Good - consistent radial depth for all particles
shower_containment.projective_tower: Variable - path length depends on eta, requires careful design

selection_criteria.rationale: Hadronic shower measurement and jet reconstruction require minimal energy loss and accurate direction measurement
